page.title: 20THE WESTCOTT NEWS JAN-AUG'85
page.content: On 27 January some thieves {vandalized}Westcott's Cricket Club. A Westcott man{attacked his baby on 17 February. An elderly woman was killed crossing the road on 24 Feb. In April a woman hiker aged 25, {died in a crash.}Also in April,the playground was given a large donation. On 14 May{Dame Anna Neagle visited{'The Hut'}at Westcott after 25 years. Also the Westcott Village Hall might close and a Westcott man is to run in the London{marathon run.}A hand granade was found by a boy in Westcott Sondes Place{Fencing Club}had {national}and{international}success with{Alison Tring, Patsy Hunt}(Wales){ and{Pauline Stonehouse}(Ireland). N.Ireland national coach{Mike Westgate and Pauline attended the{Fencing World {Championship}in Barcelona in July. {RESEARCH - SONDES PLACE SCHOOL DORKING
